p: IgG signatures in M. natalensis populations that were not PCR-positive (e.g. Ngel Nyaki) might well represent LASV or some other arenavirus, as antibodies of closely related arenaviruses are known to cross-react with the LASV antigen used in this study [ 31]. Indeed, in various parts of Africa M. natalensis is a well known carrier of arenaviruses other than LASV such as Mopeia [ 34, 35], Luna [ 36, 37] and Gairo [ 38] viruses.
